_header: Hoccleve I will it to thee knowen be
Title(s): Lady Money’s scornful answer to his petition
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, Lady Money’s scornful answer to his petition — a roundel in twenty-four lines

HunHM744.First Lines:
Hoccleue I wole it to thee knowen beI lady moneie of the world
                    goddesseÞat haue al thyng vndir my buxumnesseNat sette by thy
                    pleynte risshes threeMyn hy might haddest thow in no cheerteeWhyle I
                    was in thy slipir sikirnesse…
HunHM744.Last Lines:
…My golden heed akith for thy lewdnesseGo poore wrecche who
                    settith aght by thee
HunHM744.Attributed Title:
La response (f. 52); Cy ensuent trois chaunceons lune
                        conpleynante a la dame monoie et lautre La response dele a cellui qui se
                        conpleynt & la tierce la commendacion de ma dame (f.
                    51v)
